alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 4:05PM EST until January 01 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Minor flooding expands along the creek from near Cumming to Alpharetta and Roswell. Backyards of homes off Seale Drive and Gunter Court and portions of the Golf of Georgia begin to flood. The Big Creek Greenway experiences significant flooding up to 3 feet deep, which results in closure of most of the paths. This especially occurs upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and Rock Mill Park. A large portion of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will be under a foot of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 9 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
